fields.summary: [C++] Deprecated APIs in parquet-cpp cause pyarrow build failures

wesm commented on issue #2326: ARROW-2911: [Python] Parquet binary statistics that end in '\0' truncate last byte
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2326#issuecomment-408138815
 
 
   Thanks. I want to bring up the Arrow-Parquet monorepo discussion again. How much better would our lives be if we were able to develop this software all in the same place without these release and API change headaches? I keep thinking about ways to get rid of the build system duplication also but I don't have great ideas

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on issue #2326: ARROW-2911: [Python] Parquet binary statistics that end in '\0' truncate last byte
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2326#issuecomment-408614253
 
 
   I have also thought a lot about this as I have some fears that this repository grows too large but currently I think I'm confident in getting the Arrow build faster than improving the build structure with the two repositories. 
   
   Still, we should not convert this on the fast path to a monorepo. This would be a hard-to-reverse decision. I hope to have some time in late August to write a proposal how we could integrate both into a repo and what we need to do to keep this viable. My greatest fear is that the build will be even more red than it is currently.

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #2326: ARROW-2911: [Python] Parquet binary statistics that end in '\0' truncate last byte
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2326#issuecomment-408618545
 
 
   Almost all contributors (> 5 patches) who contribute to parquet-cpp have also contributed to Arrow. The only parquet-cpp committer who is not an Arrow committer is @majetideepak, but that could be easily fixed.
   
   I think we need to be laying plans to accommodate a C++ codebase in Arrow that exceeds 1 million lines (we are a bit under 100,000 right now). This may require a mix of lighter-weight "every commit" CI in Travis CI combined with more exhaustive unit testing in Jenkins. As two projects I've seen, Kudu and Impala have significantly longer build times and much more complex and time consuming test procedures to validate commits. Given the other challenges we've dealt with so far, scaling our build and test process seems well within our reach.
   
   What I don't really know is how to best handle the "Apache Arrow" vs "Apache Parquet" entity distinctions. There is enough overlap between committers and PMC members that we could work something out that is in the interest of the community's productivity and health.
   
   In summary, building open source software is difficult enough already. If we can ease our burden and make ourselves more productive, I think we should try to do that. 

----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

pitrou closed pull request #2326: ARROW-2911: [Python] Parquet binary statistics that end in '\0' truncate last byte
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2326
 
 
   

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pxd b/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pxd
index ca20ce21b7..564391e9ca 100644
--- a/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pxd
+++ b/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pxd
@@ -134,7 +134,7 @@ cdef extern from "parquet/api/schema.h" namespace "parquet" nogil:
         c_bool Equals(const SchemaDescriptor& other)
         int num_columns()
 
-    cdef c_string FormatStatValue(ParquetType parquet_type, const char* val)
+    cdef c_string FormatStatValue(ParquetType parquet_type, c_string val)
 
 
 cdef extern from "parquet/api/reader.h" namespace "parquet" nogil:
diff --git a/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx b/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx
index 1aa2124411..7b97d06e7a 100644
--- a/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx
+++ b/python/pyarrow/_parquet.pyx
@@ -99,7 +99,7 @@ cdef class RowGroupStatistics:
         raw_physical_type = self.statistics.get().physical_type()
         encode_min = self.statistics.get().EncodeMin()
 
-        min_value = FormatStatValue(raw_physical_type, encode_min.c_str())
+        min_value = FormatStatValue(raw_physical_type, encode_min)
         return self._cast_statistic(min_value)
 
     @property
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@ cdef class RowGroupStatistics:
         raw_physical_type = self.statistics.get().physical_type()
         encode_max = self.statistics.get().EncodeMax()
 
-        max_value = FormatStatValue(raw_physical_type, encode_max.c_str())
+        max_value = FormatStatValue(raw_physical_type, encode_max)
         return self._cast_statistic(max_value)
 
     @property
diff --git a/python/pyarrow/tests/test_parquet.py b/python/pyarrow/tests/test_parquet.py
index 1d3a6c13f1..324ae16e6c 100644
--- a/python/pyarrow/tests/test_parquet.py
+++ b/python/pyarrow/tests/test_parquet.py
@@ -630,6 +630,10 @@ def test_parquet_metadata_api():
             [True, False, False, True, True], pa.bool_(),
             'BOOLEAN', False, True, 0, 5, 0
         ),
+        (
+            [b'\x00', b'b', b'12', None, b'aaa'], pa.binary(),
+            'BYTE_ARRAY', b'\x00', b'b', 1, 4, 0
+        ),
     ]
 )
 def test_parquet_column_statistics_api(data, type, physical_type, min_value,

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description: This is due to an intermediate step treating them as c-strings.
fields.summary: [Python] Parquet binary statistics that end in '\0' truncate last byte

comments.body: This requires a parquet-cpp release to introduce a new API, delaying to 0.11.0.
This is likely related to ARROW-2800 ?
[~rgruener] no, it's unrelated. Here statistics are set and the Python code also shows them as set but the actual value that is shown in Python is wrong.
